snippet: The United States says the Mujahedeen Khalq’s relocation in Iraq from Camp Ashraf to a former United States base could help its case for removal from a list of terrorist organizations.
abstract: Secretary of State Hillary Rodham Clinton says that a decision on whether to remove an Iranian opposition group from the list of terrorist organizations would depend in part on whether more than 3,000 of its members cooperate in moving to a new location inside Iraq; the group, the Mujahedeen Khalq, or People’s Mujahedeen, is under pressure from the Iraqi government to move from Camp Ashraf, north of Baghdad.
lead_paragraph: The United States says the Mujahedeen Khalq’s relocation in Iraq from Camp Ashraf to a former United States base could help its case for removal from a list of terrorist organizations.

headline.seo: Mujahedeen Khalq Move Could Affect Terror Listing, U.S. Says
headline.main: Clinton Urges Iranian Group to Complete Move
headline.print_headline: Clinton Urges Iranian Group To Move Fully
